conbody.p: To the left of the dashboard is a summary of the nodes and the components that make up your deployment. You can start and stop any of the components from the dashboard. You can browse quickly through the display of icons beside each component. If a "Start" icon is displayed beside a component, this can alert you that the component is not in operation.

From this dashboard, you monitor your cluster by viewing the Cluster Metrics graphs displayed to the right, which show the current usage for the network, cluster load, memory and CPU. Note that clicking on the icon in the corner of the Cluster Metrics area pulls up different graph timetables for your selection.
For details on Cluster Metrics graphs, see .
Two tabs that allow you to monitor specific parts of your deployment:

ul.li: Service tab - Shows the status of the services in your SenSage AP deployment.In addition, this tab also contains a configuration link lets you change the configuration settings from the initial installation. For details, see .
Host tab - Shows the status of components in your SenSage AP deployment on a host-by-host basis.
